meanings.sent1: The autogamous plant can reproduce on its own without needing another plant.
meanings.sent2: The autogamous flower has both male and female parts, allowing it to fertilize itself.
meanings.sent3: The autogamous vegetable garden was like a self-sustaining ecosystem.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was autogamous, drawing inspiration only from within herself.
meanings.sent5: The autogamous nature of the organism made it a symbol of independence in the ecosystem.

meanings.sent1: The autogamous flower transfers pollen within itself to pollinate.
meanings.sent2: Autogamous plants do not rely on external pollinators for reproduction.
meanings.sent3: The autogamous bee was a loner, pollinating flowers all by itself.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were autogamous, spreading and pollinating within his own mind.
meanings.sent5: The autogamous nature of the plant ensured a consistent pollination process.

meanings.sent1: The autogamous fruit tree can bear fruit without cross-pollination.
meanings.sent2: Autogamous crops are advantageous as they can set fruit without external help.
meanings.sent3: The autogamous farm was a self-sufficient paradise of fertility.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was autogamous, capable of generating ideas without external input.
meanings.sent5: The autogamous nature of the soil ensured a continuous cycle of fertility.
